metadata.name: AT&T Brand Kit
metadata.description: Comprehensive AT&T brand guidelines for AI email design systems

brand_voice.description: Core communication style and personality. Brand voice is all about how we say what we say. It's a unique, ownable style of communication that brings our brand's personality and Purpose to life.

curious.summary: Listen, empathize, and connect on a personal level to truly understand people's wants and needs.
curious.description: Our Brand voice uses curiosity to bring our brand to life.
rules: Share our expertise. Help customers find what they need and resolve problems.
Listen to your audience, then communicate. Be a good listener to understand wants and needs.
Make it personal. Get to know your audience and personalize communications.
Stick with it. Be relentless in solving customer needs and staying positive.

vibrant.summary: Communicate with energy, passion, and confidence in engaging and meaningful ways.
vibrant.description: Our Brand voice uses vibrancy to communicate with energy and confidence.
rules: Inspire your audience. Give them new ideas and use aspirational language.
Be energetic. Use enthusiasm to create memorable experiences.
Be relevant. Know your audience and engage in ways that interest them.
Show confidence. Communicate with optimism about our capabilities.

human.summary: Down-to-earth, honest, and relatable. Keep things clear and simple by talking like real people.
human.description: Our Brand voice remains down-to-earth and relatable.
rules: Keep it simple. Use straightforward language, avoiding technical jargon.
Be relatable. Use conversational language that connects with people.
Be supportive. Show empathy and concern for personal needs.
Say what you mean. Be direct without being pushy. Avoid exaggerations or clichés.

tones.description: While we should always use our brand voice consistently, we also need some flexibility in how we communicate.

rules: Speak conversationally and make it personal.
Use contractions and natural language.
Simplify technical and legal content to make it easily understood.
Demonstrate why we're the best instead of just saying it.
Focus on customer benefits rather than competitors.
Communicate with confidence without being arrogant.
Use humor sparingly and appropriately.
Don't make jokes that could offend.
Avoid humor if it does not suit the context.

primary.name: AT&T Blue
primary.usage: Links, primary CTAs, brand accents, headers

accent.name: Dark Gray
accent.usage: Body text, secondary copy, fine print

do: Use first and second person perspectives
Use active voice instead of passive
Write for accessibility, diversity, and inclusion
Use short, descriptive headings for complex concepts
Capitalize only proper nouns and branded terms
Limit exclamation marks to impactful situations
dont: Repeat the exact words of the Purpose statement
Use unnecessary jargon, slang, or acronyms
Be pushy or aggressive in tone

preview_text.purpose: Complete subject line with compelling preview

headings.hierarchy: Use H1 for main, H2 for sections, H3 for subsections

guidelines: Feature diverse representations of people and situations
Show products in real-world, relatable contexts
Maintain consistent color grading and filters
Use lifestyle imagery that conveys tangible customer value
Ensure images are compressed and optimized for email
Always include alt text for accessibility
Use AT&T brand assets when available
forbidden: Images that don't align with brand aesthetics

optimization.recommended_format: JPG for photos, PNG for graphics

legal_requirements.unsubscribe: Always include visible unsubscribe link in footer
legal_requirements.footer: Include sender address and contact information

ai_instructions.description: Specific instructions for AI email design systems using this brandkit
ai_instructions.system_prompt_segment: You are designing marketing and transactional emails for AT&T, a leading telecommunications and technology company. Your role is to create emails that reflect AT&T's brand voice and guidelines while serving the specific communication goal. Always adhere to these core principles: (1) Be Curious - Listen to customer needs and personalize communication. Share expertise to help customers find what they need. Make it personal. (2) Be Vibrant - Communicate with energy and confidence. Use aspirational language and show enthusiasm for what AT&T offers. Inspire your audience with new ideas. (3) Be Human - Keep language simple and conversational. Avoid technical jargon. Be relatable and supportive. Say what you mean without exaggeration. Maintain these characteristics across all generated content while adapting tone to the specific context.
ai_instructions.voice_consistency_rules: Maintain AT&T's Curious, Vibrant, and Human voice across all email copy. Match tone to email use case: (1) Relatable tone for support emails - make them personal and understandable. (2) Confident tone for product launches - demonstrate benefits, not just features. (3) Humorous tone only when appropriate to context and audience. Never let tone override the primary voice characteristics. Every sentence should feel like it comes from AT&T's perspective of understanding and helping customers.

design_constraints.color_palette: Use AT&T Blue (#0068A5) for links and CTAs only. Use clean whites (#FFFFFF) and light grays (#F6F6F6) for backgrounds. Use dark gray (#555555) for body text. Limit color variety - maximum 3 colors in design.
design_constraints.image_requirement: Hero image is optional but recommended for product/promotional emails. When included, ensure high quality, brand alignment, and accessibility with alt text.
design_constraints.typography: Use Arial, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, or sans-serif fallback. H1 max 38px, H2 24px, body 14px. Maintain readability on mobile (min 14px for body text).
design_constraints.responsive: Ensure design is fully responsive at 595px desktop width, adapting for mobile at 615px breakpoint and below.

cta_requirements.text_style: Button-style with clear action text (e.g., 'Learn More', 'Claim Offer', 'Get Started')
cta_requirements.action_text_guidelines: Use active, benefit-focused language. Examples: 'Learn More About Fiber', 'Claim Your Offer', 'Start Saving Today', 'Get Help Now'

copy_guidelines.subject_line: 40-50 characters, personalized when possible, no ALL CAPS, benefits-focused
copy_guidelines.headings: Clear, benefit-focused, conversational tone, 8-10 words max
copy_guidelines.body_copy: Short paragraphs (3-4 sentences), simple language, active voice, reader benefits first
copy_guidelines.exclusions: No industry jargon, no exaggerations, no competitor mentions, no overly promotional language
